intro: Sideroxylon discolor, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Sideroxylon discolor is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
